intro: Tofieldia nutans var. rubescens, commonly known as the red-veined tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its reddish veins on the leaves give it a distinctive appearance, making it easily identifiable. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks.
